Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2009 03:33PM just_mary wrote: Hi ladies, Just found your site here.  It seems like its all going to fast, I'm in a daze.  I've already been though what some of you are now doing.  Each time I go back to the dr. it seems to change.  Started out with just a incision biopsy and I'll be done- wrong-came back the mass was invasive.  I have had a sentinel node biopsy that ended up being a axillary dissection, along with my lumpectomy.  I have now learned that the invasive ductal carcinoma is with multivocal areas of intraductal carcinoma, in shorter terms, it is all over the breast tissue, yep you guess it  now I go see the surg to have my left breast removed.  I'm also a DDD, so a reduction has been suggested and recon for the left side. I see the dr June 9, 2009 and I would love to have it all done at one time.  My chemo dr. wants to start asap.  I'm pulled in everyway you can think of. I'm a stage 2 with sentinel node and the seven lymph nodes they tested with metastatic carcinoma involvement.  Does it ever end????    fighting the battle and praying for us all      Mary
Posts.Title: DCIS lynniejojo lynniejojo

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 03:19PM just_mary wrote: I like alot of the ladies on here, have been there to.  The most important thing to me was to keep my breast, as it is with all of us ladies.  I would chose the lumpectomy first, it may be all she needs.  In my case they found more cancer than what they expected.  So now it on to the mastectomy and learning to deal with it all.  She's a lucky women to have you in this important decision, you cared enough to turn to this site. Ask alot of questions and read alot.  I find the more I learn the easier it is to deal with.  God bless you and your wife and all of us on this site.   just_mary
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy or Mastectomy??? 2667 2667

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2009 12:45PM just_mary wrote: Hi Ladies, Quess I'm with you guys, I will be getting my picc line in this week and chemo starts. Right now, we're waiting on an infection that flaired up in my incision from lumpectomy, talking about one RED HOT BOOB.  I'll be getting A/C for 4 doses, than Taxotere for 4 doses.  I see the Rad. Dr. next week to see when that starts.  The surg. Dr. is waiting for chemo to be done, before I get my mastectomy on both breast.  Only one has cancer but, dr. said for them to match, it would be best to take them both...So, I believe that's what I'm going to do. God Bless you all,  Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 06:25PM just_mary wrote: amig1, they gave me meds. before the a/c to help with nausea. I also get migraines real bad, I take maxalt for them.  I left there today with a lite headache, its now almost 5 hours later and its about the same if not a little less.  I get a feeling every now and then like I'm going to be sick,  but so far it has passed.  I'll take the meds. rx for that in the morning and evening on days 2 and 3.  I've got another one for anytime I feel that way. Oh, how I hope these pills work.  Good luck on your first treatment tomorrow, I'll keep you in my prays. ( It took about 2 1/2 hours to get it all in me.) Good Luck to all, Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 03:59PM just_mary wrote: cherneski, I might be ahead of you, I love ice cream sandwich's The box has 12 and there are only 4 left, make that 3 left.  I can live on it if I have too.  I hope your honey gets home soon, or you may not be hungry enough for steak and mash potatoes.  Don't forget the rolls, if there big and fluffy... Have a Great Evening, Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2009 12:41PM just_mary wrote: Hi Ladies, My onc called, picc line goes in Thurs. 6-18 and first A/C is Mon. 6-22..  I have been reading all your post and I am as prepared as I can be.  God only knows how it will affect me, I'm praying for the least of it all.   This thing is a total mind game, alot of ups and downs, you think your in charge, then it all falls apart again.  But its ok, we are entitled to laugh, scream, cry, we are facing something we never dreamed we would.  God will help us each and everyone, just ask him. God Bless you all,  Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2009 03:27PM just_mary wrote: Hi ladies, I start my chemo Mon. 6-21, I'll be starting on the a/c.  I ask my onc how long the injections would take and he said 4-5 minutes???  When done with the 8 weeks of that, I'll start Taxotere, and stated that takes about 4 hours to inject.  Anyone on a/c? Is the time frame correct. If so I'll be driving 45 minutes each way for just a few minutes. I'm not complaining, maybe I should go shopping at the mall while I'm there. (I live in a rural area, you know the sticks.) I am starting to get nervous about this, and pray I'm ready.  I've already cut my hair short, but will wait for signs before shaving.  I got a mesh hair net to sleep in, just in case. God help us all, Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 03:14PM just_mary wrote: EngTchr, Its probably my fault, I got sick, because after doing so I read the instructions, TAKE WITH FOOD  (LOL) quess what I didn't do!!!   When I had lunch today, I took one of my companize and its all good. Won't make that mistake twice.  Just got back from getting my neulasta shot, she said the bones may hurt, I suppose we get it all, aren't we lucky. amlg1, I hope all went well with your first treatment today. I have been thinking about you and your are in my prays.  Keep us updated on your se's, which, I pray are very few.  As of this moment, I feel ok, a little sleepy but, I've had a long day. Still have a mild headache, but I can handle that I'm use to migraines, so its not that bad.( I've got vicodin's) God Bless us all,  Just_Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 05:16PM just_mary wrote: Candy, as someone stated earlier, it is against the law. We as cancer patients are most certainly protected. My boss is working with me and not complaining at all, and I am very gratefull for that. You need to check with yout local welfare office and maybe also the American Cancer Society, they should have some answes for you.  Good Luck,  Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2009 03:07PM just_mary wrote: zoohouse10, When we found out mom had cancer, we were told she carried a rare gen.cancer gene, 50-50 we kids carry it.  No, I've not been tested as of yet, they keep saying since my mom was 64 when disgnosed I'm safe.  I don't believe that for a moment!!! I'm a (DDD) and I just feel for me, the best thing is to do a double mast. , my surg. has also said the same.  I'll be seeing the plastic surg. team at Ohio State on July 10, so I'm not jumping to anything, without being informed to the most.  I just want to have even results at the end of all of this, and the least chance of repeating this nightmare we are all living.   My honey is with me all the way, says he loves me the person not the boobs (lol), oh what a relieve!!! My head is itching, I think I'm getting parnoid....  I think my neice had more fun than me shopping, since I paid for it all and she loves to shop for cloths...I say you only live once, enjoy.... You gals are all in my thoughts and prays each and everyday. We are being tested right now for what ever reason, but we will endure and come out tougher than we ever thought possible.  Sounds like we also have wonderful men in our lives to stand right beside us too. God Bless us All, Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2009 05:14PM just_mary wrote: Hi Ladies, just_mary here, I've been gone for a couple weeks, on Monday June 29, I had only had 1 chemo treatment.  I started running a temp of 103  went to ER and was admitted because I had 0 white blood cells and my red was very low.  My left breast with has the cancer became inflamed and hard as a rock.  After 1 1/2 weeks in the hospital it was decided I needed to have the breast removed.  I had to talk the dr. into taking both off.  He did on July 8, 2009  and it turned out the right breast had infection in it also.  So I'm home after a two week stay there and both breast are gone!!!  Thank God!!!    My hair started falling out on day 10 after my 1 st chemo, and I talked a male nurse into bringing his shears from home and we had a head shaving party about 10:30 PM one night, and it was a relieve to get rid of it, the hair was everywhere. So, I'll try to keep updated on everyone here every couple days, I'm still very weak and very sore from the surgery.  But, I tell you, I am so grateful to be alive and know that most of the cancer is out of my body.  As soon as I've healed enough I'm to resume my chemo and my onco.promises to watch me ever so closely to keep my red and white blood cells up to a save level.  I also had to have my pic line taken out, because I got a skin bacteria when it when in, one of the causes for the high temps. I kept running.. God Bless you all, and I pray no one has to go through what I had happen so suddenly to me. Just_Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2009 06:52AM just_mary wrote: Hi Ladies, I've been out of the hospital a week and 2 days now.  I'm getting stronger each day, and I take walks that help alot.  I now have an infection in my breast area, both sides, don't know how that is possible after having both breast removed.  I'm going to see my surg. today and I'm on meds, to help clear it up. No reconstruction was done, due to the infection.  At this time I don't even know that I want to do that later.  The pain is unreal at times, the entire breast bone area is so sore.  I was very large (DDD) and to now have nothing, and believe it or not I'm fine with that.  I'm alive and that is the most important thing to me and my husband.  I'm going to call my onco. to see when we will resume my chemo treatments.  I'm really afraid to start again, after the first one putting me in the hospital.  My honey says I'm the prettiest bald headed, flat chested women he knows.  (lol) I pray that all is well with all you ladies, the best in your chemo treatments, remain strong and God Bless you all. Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2009 01:23PM just_mary wrote: Hi Ladies, 3 days after first a/c---acid refux is not fun at all.  I've had it since day 1 and I'll talk with the onc. next week, tums help but not enough. The anti-nausea pills are helping, today I'm feeling tired more so than usual  for me.  Only went to wal-mart and had to come home and rest. When I first get up in the mornings I don't feel good at all, like I'm gonna be sick, but after eating and getting a pill down me it slowly passes. Hope all is as will as it can be for all of you, brave ladies and that we are.  Hang in there and we can lean on each other for strength. God bless us all, Mary

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 07:57AM just_mary wrote: I've not been on for a few days, so reading and catching up on everyone.  I pray the side effects let up on you ladies.  My turn is coming, I leave in about 1/2 hour for my first A/C treatment.  I'm a little afraid of how the se will be with me.  I always seem to get all the se from any medicine I take.  The dr. finally told me, it would take about 3 hours to get all this crap in me.  I have hobby's, but none I could take with me, so now I have started reading romance novels (lol) think that will get me through this.  Going to eat lunch before I go, hope that's not a bad ideal, if so, I won't repeat it next time. Good Luck to all on your treatments, just remember, if this kills the cancer then it is worth everything we're going through. God Bless us all, Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 03:30PM just_mary wrote: Well, I've got my first A/C done.  Left there feeling a little lite headed and a headache starting.  I'm home now and have been resting and trying to drink alot of water.  Dr. recommended water for the first day and day after A/C to flush me out good.  That means up all night running you know where.  I didn't sleep good last night, worried about today.  Hopefully, I'll do better tonight.  I've been following all your post and will be watching for signs of s/e, but praying they don't find me..  I'm praying for everyone that all goes well.. All my prayers, Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 11:32AM just_mary wrote: Hi Ladies, Day 2 after first a/c treatment, didin't sleep well last night, up alot running to the bathroom.  All that water..  Got up this morning, after about 1/2 hr, I was hanging over the toilet bowl, oh what fun..They say this gets worst with each treatment, I surely hope not!!!    After that, I felt better and headed off to work, I am a Home Health Aid, funny I take care of people, and I need more help than most of them. Oh, I'm not bitter, I really love my patients. I just had lunch and took a compazine, hope it works.  I now have to drive 45 minutes to go to the onc. office to get my shot, 24 hrs after a/c dose.  Hope everyone is doing ok with all the wonderful se's, we are strong and will all come through this tougher than ever. Have faith,  Mary.

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2009 03:53PM just_mary wrote: I've got a question, and I know one of you ladies have found the answer.  I just got my picc line put in today, located between my shoulder and elbow (enter arm area).  So here they dangle, I'm afraid I'll pull them while I sleep????  And how do you keep it dry while you shower?? I'm open to any little secrets someone has found, please help... I thought it was bad enough with my left arm usage limited due to axillary dissection, now this?? DBATT  sorry you are having problem with your partner, you have enough on your mind right now, we are here for you and in my prayers.  Hopefully, you will keep the chemo se on your side and breeze through it.  I start my Mon 6-22, so I pray I am able to do the same. God Bless us all, Mary

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 11:40AM just_mary wrote: gjlanders, I got a hair net to wear to bed around day 10 or so.  I don't want to wake up with a bed full of hair.  My plan is to have it shaved as soon as I show signs of it coming out.  I had long hair and I've already cut it very short. (donated a 14" pony to locks of love)  I had a purpose with the hair so it didn't bother me at all. I think to shave it off would be less of a shock than the slow process of watching it fall out.  I wish you good luck with whatever you decide, it is so personal a decission. God Bless You, Mary

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2009 07:47AM just_mary wrote: Oh Bettina, so sorry, noone should touch your hair, no matter how cute it is, they'll mess it up (lol)!  When I go to the onc. next week for a consult of the side effects I've had, we will take care of this d---  acid refux--its a killer....tums won't hardly even touch it.  Its day 4 and I'm feeling tired, I'm gonna make my self take a walk today. I'm heading after my 14 year old neice, and go shopping and get out of here.  She's more of a daughter to me, I love her to death, said she would help me around the house when I needed help...(I have a son) I shave my honey's head, he might actually enjoy shaving mine, I was gonna have my hair dresser do it, but I think I'll let him, if he is brave enough  (I can be very mouthy)....be my luck my hair will come out while his in the hospital with this cancer surg. (colon is coming completely out) but his alive, second time with his beast.. After I get through this chemo session, I'm having a double mastectomy, not taking any chances, my left breast is multifocal spread, and my mom died of this 9 years ago- not me, I'm with you girls we will beat this and stand strong, no hair and all!!! All my prayers, Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2009 01:58PM just_mary wrote: Hi Ladies, Diane- On July 8, 2009 I had both breast removed and was home 2 days later, my biggest problem was my left breast was inflamed (cancer) right one no cancer.  My decision for both was an easy one for me, I was a DDD and knew I couldn't handle one that large with nothing on the other side. I was sure I could not handle having no breast at all. I was wrong, I'm now considering not even doing reconstruction.  I have some soreness in the breast bone area, but its not that bad.  First couple days are the hardest, when getting up or down.  You do what you feel is best for you, we all have different pain levels.  Keep reading and researching and ask God for his help, and he will.  That's how I came to my answer. I see my surgeon next Tuesday for a decision on my left side, my trouble side-may need another surg. to  fix it (skin dying)  due to the infection I have on that side. Then its to my onco.to see about getting me back to chemo treatments, his thinking about putting me on the chemo pill while my breast is healing. Keeping all of you in my prayers as we fight this battle that we will all win.... Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2009 02:34PM just_mary wrote: hi, I saw my surg. today, he doesn't like the looks of the site when my left breast was.  He is giving it one week to do what it is going to do with healing.  At that point I may have to have another surgery.  Oh, I pray not.  Its swollen and discolored and the skin is dying off.  The right side looks great.  Dr. says its because of all the infection I had before surgery, so time will tell....please keep me in your prayers.  I just want to heal so that I can get my chemo started again.  My husband was in the hospital the same time I was for colon cancer, and he will be taking chemo with me.  We call it the family cancer program. (lol)  We are keeping our chins up and staying strong.  Stay strong and God Bless us all Mary
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 08:21PM just_mary wrote: Amuta, You can also contact your local American Cancer Society, or your local Hospital where her mammo was done, usually have someone with all kinds of info.  I just had my first chemo today and I'm in the starting June 2009 group here, they have been alot of help.  Just ask questions and the answer will follow.  The ladies here are great, I'm glad I found them.  Thank you for being a great daughter for your mum, she will need you, more than you know. I lost my mom 9 years ago, so I turned here for answer.  I'll add you and your mum to my pray list, as I have all the ladies here.  God Bless you, Mary

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2009 04:03PM just_mary wrote: Just found this topic, and got a question.  I start my chemo in a couple weeks and he is putting me on Adriamycin/cyclophosphamide for 2 months and then onto Taxol/Taxotere for the next 2 months. Dr. said I would lose my hair, I quess he said that because my hair is so long. Didn't want me to have any false hopes.  Has anyone here had those treatments and how long afterwards did it begin to come out?? I'm trying to get ready for all this, but its very hard. God bless you all,  Mary

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2009 04:25PM just_mary wrote: Paula, My husband and I went an bought me a short wig yesterday.  I am getting my hair cut this coming Wednesday (donating to locks of love) and earlier today I went on-line and ordered some hats from "tlc" they have some really cute hats. I try to keep my spirits up and pray alot.  I lost my mom to breast cancer 9 years ago she had just turned 65 years old, much to young..  My mom had alot of strength, she never cried once, oh how I wish I could do that.  Some day are good and other I cry alot, people just don't understand how we feel.  I love this site for that exact reason, we do know what it's like. God bless you all,  Mary

June 9, 2009.   Its just too much at one time, and my honey is having his second cancer surg. on July 1. His a  man, they don't cry  LOL  but he trys to understand me. Thanks again,  Mary
